info.name: Postman Filesystem API
info.description:
# Expose local directory CRUD for use with Postman

## Features

- üîí Secure authentication with token
- üìÅ CRUD operations for files and directories
- üîç Directory listing
- üö´ Path traversal protection
- üåê Web UI for easy file management
- üê≥ Docker support
- üìö Postman collection included

### Authentication

All API endpoints (except token setup) require a Bearer token in the Authorization header:
```
Authorization: Bearer your-token
```

### Endpoints

#### Authentication
- `POST /api/auth/setup` - Set up authentication token
  ```http
  POST /api/auth/setup
  Content-Type: application/json

  {
      "token": "your-secret-token"
  }
  ```

#### Files
- `GET /api/files/{path}` - Read file contents
  - Returns file content with appropriate Content-Type header
  - Supports both binary and text files
  - Returns 400 if path points to a directory
  - Returns 404 if file not found

- `POST /api/files/{path}` - Create/Upload file
  - Upload using multipart/form-data with "file" field
  - Returns 400 if path points to a directory
  - Returns 404 if parent directory not found

- `PUT /api/files/{path}` - Update file contents
  ```http
  Content-Type: application/json

  {
      "content": "Updated file content"
  }
  ```
  - Returns 400 if path points to a directory
  - Returns 404 if file not found

- `DELETE /api/files/{path}` - Delete file
  - Returns 400 if path points to a directory
  - Returns 404 if file not found

#### Directories
- `GET /api/directories/{path}` - List directory contents
  - Lists all files and subdirectories
  - Use without path parameter to list root directory
  - Returns array of items with metadata:
  ```json
  [
      {
          "name": "example.txt",
          "path": "folder/example.txt",
          "isDirectory": false,
          "size": 1234,
          "modified": "2024-01-20T12:00:00.000Z"
      }
  ]
  ```

- `POST /api/directories/{path}` - Create directory
  - Returns 400 if directory exists
  - Returns 404 if parent directory not found

- `DELETE /api/directories/{path}` - Delete directory
  - Returns 400 if directory not empty
  - Returns 404 if directory not found

### Error Responses

All error responses follow this format:
```json
{
    "error": "Error message description",
    "code": "ERROR_CODE"  // Optional error code
}
```

Common status codes:
- 400: Bad Request
- 401: Unauthorized
- 404: Not Found
- 500: Internal Server Error

request.description:
# File Download

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the file "file.txt".

### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{baseUrl}}/api/files/file.txt`
    

### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: text/plain
    

The response contains the content of the file "file.txt", which in this case is "Hello, World!".

# File Upload

This endpoint allows you to upload a file to the server.

## Request Body

- `content`: The content of the file to be uploaded.
    

## Response

- `message`: A message indicating the status of the file upload.

This endpoint allows you to update the content of a specific file by sending an HTTP PUT request to {{baseUrl}}/api/files/file.txt.

### Request Body

The request should include a raw JSON body with the following parameter:

- `content`: The updated content of the file.
    

### Response

Upon a successful execution, the endpoint returns a 200 status with a JSON response containing a `message` key. The value of the `message` key will provide information about the success of the update operation.

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "message": ""
}

 ```

### Delete File

Deletes the specified file from the server.

#### Request Body

This endpoint does not require a request body.

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

``` json
{
    "message": ""
}

 ```

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the list of subdirectories and ordinary files within the specified "sub-folder" directory.

### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: {{baseUrl}}/api/directories/sub-folder
    

### Response

The endpoint returns a JSON array with objects representing the subdirectories and ordinary files within the "sub-folder" directory. Each object in the array includes the following properties:

- "name": (string) The name of the subdirectory or file.
    
- "path": (string) The path of the subdirectory or file.
    
- "isDirectory": (boolean) Indicates whether the item is a directory (true) or a file (false).
    
- "size": (number) The size of the file in bytes. For directories, the size is 0.
    
- "modified": (string) The date and time when the item was last modified.
    

Example response:

``` json
[
    {
        "name": "",
        "path": "",
        "isDirectory": true,
        "size": 0,
        "modified": ""
    }
]

 ```

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of all entries in the root data directory, including ordinary files and subdirectories. The response will be in JSON format and will include the name, path, whether it is a directory, size, and modification details for each entry.

- "name": (string) The name of the directory.
    
- "path": (string) The path of the directory.
    
- "isDirectory": (boolean) Indicates whether the item is a directory.
    
- "size": (number) The size of the directory.
    
- "modified": (string) The date when the directory was last modified.

response.body:
[
    {
        "name": "deepseek-qwen.png",
        "path": "deepseek-qwen.png",
        "isDirectory": false,
        "size": 518483,

        "name": "file.txt",
        "path": "file.txt",
        "isDirectory": false,
        "size": 20,
        "modified": "2025-02-18T09:16:57.376Z"
    },
    {

        "path": "file2.txt",

    },
    {
        "name": "hihi",
        "path": "hihi",
        "isDirectory": true,
        "size": 128,
        "modified": "2025-02-18T09:12:07.866Z"
    },
    {
        "name": "hoho",
        "path": "hoho",
        "isDirectory": true,
        "size": 64,

    }
]

request.description:
### Add Sub-Folder

This endpoint allows the user to add a sub-folder within the directories.

**Request Body**

- No request body parameters required.
    

**Response**

- Status: 200 OK
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- { "message": ""}
